segments.text: How do you think the transport system in our city could be improved ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I think that the public transport system could be made simpler . I never know where the bus routes actually go . The routes seem to twist and turn rather than going roughly in a straight line .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I think we just need to build more roads . Then there would be more space for cars to drive and we ’ d have fewer traffic jams .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: If we built more roads , people would just fill them with cars again . I think we should discourage people from using their cars .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I think we should do a few things at once . Improving public transport would encourage people to use that . If we also charge people to use their cars in the city centre , they won ’ t use their cars as much .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I don ’ t know . I think it ’ s unfair to make drivers pay more money . They already pay a lot of tax-petrol tax , for example .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I think that they should pay more tax . Look at the damage they cause to the environment and people ’ s health by discharging all those exhaust fumes .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: The air would certainly be cleaner if there were fewer cars being used in the city . The problem is that people will see it as reducing their freedom . It well be unpopular .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That ’ s a good point . Car owners will probably be against it , but people who use public transport will be in favor of it .
segments.speaker: S2
